name: gnotifier
author: Michal Kosciesza <michal@mkiol.net>
title: GNotifier
description: GNotifier integrates Firefox/Thunderbird's notifications with the native notification system. It supports most Linux desktops, Windows 8.1 and 10

preferences.name: engine
preferences.title: Notification engine
preferences.description: Defines how notification will be displayed. Possible options are: Firefox's built-in engine (Standard), OS native engine (GNotifier) or Custom shell command (Custom command).

preferences.name: clickOption
preferences.title: Default click action
preferences.description: Defines default click action for download complete notification.

preferences.name: downloadCompleteAlert
preferences.title: Download complete notification
preferences.description: Defines if downloads complete notification should be shown everytime when downloading is finished.

preferences.name: excludedExtensionsList
preferences.title: List of excluded file extensions
preferences.description: Comma separated list of filename extensions that will not trigger Download Complete notification. Example: "html, js, jpg".

preferences.name: command
preferences.title: Custom command
preferences.description: Defines custom shell command that will be executed. This option is applicable only if engine option is set to 'Custom' value. Note that notification title, text or image you can pass to command with following variables: %title, %text, %image.

preferences.name: notifyIcon
preferences.title: Notification Icon
preferences.description: Icon used for "Download Complete" and "New E-mail" notifications. It can be either icon URL or name. Examples: "file://c:\my-cool-icon.png", "nightly", "aurora" or "gnotifier". If value is set to "default" then icon will be set based on application name.

preferences.name: timeout
preferences.title: Notification timeout (Linux only)
preferences.description: Sets the timeout of the notification in seconds. To set the default time, pass "0" value. Note that the timeout may be ignored by some servers.

preferences.name: timeoutExpire
preferences.title: Notification expiration (Linux only)
preferences.description: Sets the notification to expire after defined timeout (true) or to never expire (false). Note that it may be ignored by some servers.

preferences.name: enableRSS
preferences.title: Notifications for RSS feeds (Thunderbird only)
preferences.description: Defines wheter notifications for new RSS items should be displayed.

preferences.name: maxMessageBuffer
preferences.title: Maximum number of simultaneous notifications (Thunderbird only)
preferences.description: Defines the maximum number of simultaneous notifications for new messages. For instance, "5" means that if you receive less or equal 5 messages at once, all will trigger individual notification, but if you receive more than 6 new messages at once, only 1 aggregated notification will be shown. Set to "0" to disable aggregation.

preferences.name: newMailOpen
preferences.title: Open new message action (Thunderbird only)
preferences.description: Defines how new messages should be opened when you click on notification.

preferences.name: clickOptionNewEmail
preferences.title: Default click action for E-mail notifications (Thunderbird only)
preferences.description: Defines default click action for e-mail notification.

preferences.name: emailTitleFormat
preferences.title: Title for E-mail notifications (Thunderbird only)
preferences.description: %s: Subject, %a: Sender (Name <E-mail>), %m: Sender E-mail, %n: Sender Name, %f: Folder, %v: Server, %k: Size, %u: Account, %b: Body excerpt, %c: Number of unread messages, %%: %

preferences.name: emailTextFormat
preferences.title: Text for E-mail notifications (Thunderbird only)
preferences.description: %s: Subject, %a: Sender (Name <E-mail>), %m: Sender E-mail, %n: Sender Name, %f: Folder, %v: Server, %k: Size, %u: Account, %b: Body excerpt, %c: Number of unread messages, %%: %, \n: Newline

preferences.name: foldersAllowedList
preferences.title: List of folders to allow notifications from (Thunderbird only)
preferences.description: Comma seperated list of folder names (or account name, folder name pairs). For example:  "My email|Inbox, My folder" will only allow notifications from "Inbox" folder under "My email" account and from any folder with name "My folder". Set to blank to allow all.

preferences.name: test
preferences.title: Test Notification (Thunderbird only)
preferences.label: Test notification
preferences.description: Select a message from any folder, then come back and click on 'Test notification'
